definition: Ibrahim (name)/Arabic and Islamic version of Abraham 亞伯拉罕|亚伯拉罕
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Dole (name)/Bob Dole (1923-), US Republican politician, Kansas senator 1969-1996
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Safi (Moroccan city on the Atlantic coast)
Maliki or Al-Maliki (name)/Nouri Kamel al-Maliki (1950-) prime minister of Iraq from 2006
